TopicTitle: Show off your KSP Blender Renders!

Articles.Content:
> 
> Moving the fire off into its own scene that is separate but linked is what you would need to do to efficiently render the fire currently. I think the problem then is getting the fire simulator to properly interact with a linked object in another scene. Not really played with using different scenes yet so I can't say for sure if or how that would work. 
> Just adding an NVIDIA card to your system will work fine. Set it in your preferences and your off. Your power supply might have a word or two about that addition ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

i do that when ever i need to render fire or smoke or a volumetric entity in general, clone the final scene and render out the volumetric passes aswell as a mask and reflection/lighting passes and composite them.

i use a nvidia gtx 980 and octane render as the primary one.

Request from Zamovinar of Kraken Technologies.

![p0sdhtE.png](http://i.imgur.com/p0sdhtE.png)

If someone has a stock craft they would like to see rendered I would be happy to give it a try. Just drop me a line via message and we'll see what kind of trouble we can get that craft file into.

While peeking through the craft exchange thread I stumbled across this awesome replica craft by RevanCorana and thought I would do a drive by render. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif) StarCitizen players will recognize this beauty! Decided to keep the render nice and clean this time and I think it came out fairly well.

Check out this craft in depth [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113948-X-85-Runabout-%28StarCitizen-Replica%29-ION-Jet-SSTO)!

> ![2ZqfAoe.png](http://i.imgur.com/2ZqfAoe.png)

Yet another drive by rendering, this time of MajorJim's Curiosity replica. ( I need to stay out of that craft exchange thread.....) This thing is awesome! I mean look at it!!!! Find the thread with this craft file and many others [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81526-Majorjim-s-stock-craft-repository).

MJ

Now that I've got my computer setup after moving I can work on some things again. Played around a little with Blender/KSP on my laptop but it's a little slow.

Thanks Sma! I thought I would try that look Starwhip made look so effortlessly cool.
esinohio just FYI, but Squad featured your Bubble Ship render on their FB page! Congratulations ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

> 
> esinohio just FYI, but Squad featured your Bubble Ship render on their FB page! Congratulations ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Awesome!! I really enjoy doing these but can't take any real credit for them. You craft designers do all the work!!

On that note here is another simple render featuring the stunningly accurate F-22 Raptor by Eorin. Accurate is an understatement here! Look at his own pictures in the thread and see how fast the KerbPaint mod takes this into the realm of insanely cool. Check this replica out [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114135-F-22-Raptor-replica). Accuracy overlay [**here!!**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/114135-F-22-Raptor-replica?p=1808829&viewfull=1#post1808829) 

> ![28G8uiz.png](http://i.imgur.com/28G8uiz.png)

\*\*edit : This is one of many that will be done again!

Hey esinohio!

I know you are still brewing my tank, but here is a cool ship I made some year back, but this time it is a bit more spacey:

![13993247871_ede7dab42a_o.png](https://farm6.staticflickr.com/5175/13993247871_ede7dab42a_o.png)

A cool render would be it being in orbit and shooting a rod down. 

Download: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/08ctatc6aufi4pi/LOKI.craft](https://www.dropbox.com/s/08ctatc6aufi4pi/LOKI.craft)
I've been gone from this forum for a while... like, more than half a year, so has anyone 3D printed one of their ships yet?

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-31T20:41:00Z" title="03/31/2015 08:41  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 31, 2015</time> by esinohio**

Request from Majorjim for a hangar scene. Below we see a pair of Kerbals readying the Eagle-1 for flight.

Ok I'm a sucker for these open cockpit designs. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif) This SSTO is a gem!! The flight instructions provided will get even novice pilots into orbit in no time. Once in orbit deploy your Ion craft and have some more fun with a quick spin around the Mun! The addition of an entrance on the bottom complete with doors was just one of many over the top cool features on this one.

Get this epic craft [**here**](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/81526-Majorjim-s-stock-craft-repository?p=1184908&viewfull=1#post1184908). (Some craft in a state of update flux and are for older versions!!)

> ![P0079w2.png](http://i.imgur.com/P0079w2.png)

>
